p: Although poplars do not have close homologues to Arabidopsis FLC, they do have FLC-like genes [ 82, 83]. It seems likely that also in poplar chilling removes an inhibitory module, as 5 °C-chilling of dormant buds hyperinduces FT1. This could involve CO, which encodes a B-box protein that binds to the FT promoter in a complex with AS1 [ 84]. CO expression in dormant buds of hybrid aspen increases during chilling, but in contrast, pre-dormancy chilling significantly reduced it (Fig. 6). This is congruent with the fact that pre-dormancy chilling did not upregulate FT1 to the high level found during chilling of dormant buds (Fig. 7a, c). In adult poplar trees, FT1 upregulation and acquisition of floral competence promotes floral transition [ 39, 41, 42].
